bug.author: saskatchewancatch
bug.summary: Enabling CV_DISABLE_OPTIMIZATION causes CMake configuration crash
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV => master Operating System / Platform => Windows 64 Bit Compiler => Visual Studio 15 2017 Win64
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
When doing Configure on master branch in Windows with CV_DISABLE_OPTIMIZATION checked, it causes the CMake configuration process to fail on errors like these: <denchmark-code>CMake Error at cmake/OpenCVUtils.cmake:331 (target_include_directories): Cannot specify include directories for target "opencv_test_core_SSE4_1" which is not built by this project. Call Stack (most recent call first): cmake/OpenCVModule.cmake:675 (ocv_target_include_directories) cmake/OpenCVModule.cmake:1239 (ocv_target_include_modules) modules/core/CMakeLists.txt:97 (ocv_add_accuracy_tests)
CMake Error at cmake/OpenCVUtils.cmake:331 (target_include_directories): Cannot specify include directories for target "opencv_test_core_SSE4_2" which is not built by this project. Call Stack (most recent call first): cmake/OpenCVModule.cmake:675 (ocv_target_include_directories) cmake/OpenCVModule.cmake:1239 (ocv_target_include_modules) modules/core/CMakeLists.txt:97 (ocv_add_accuracy_tests)
..... </denchmark-code>
and many more of the same error for the various components that are selected for building. <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
In Windows 10 x64, CMake (v3.7.2), clone the repo, checkout master branch, and run CMake Configure with Visual Studio 15 2017 Win64 as the compiler.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:http://pullrequest.opencv.org/buildbot/builders/3_4_noOCL_noICV_noSSE-win64-vc14-debug/builds/548>Can't reproduce</denchmark-link> . Provide exact command parameters for CMake and its output.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/alalek>@alalek</denchmark-link> I used the CMake GUI. I hit Configure, then when it returns the list of build parameters, I enable CV_DISABLE_OPTIMIZATION and hit Generate (or Configure). Below is the output. <denchmark-code>Detected processor: AMD64 Could NOT find PythonInterp: Found unsuitable version "1.4", but required is at least "3.2" (found C:/Users/sc/AppData/Local/Microsoft/WindowsApps/python3.exe) libjpeg-turbo: VERSION = 2.0.2, BUILD = opencv-4.1.2-dev-libjpeg-turbo found Intel IPP (ICV version): 2019.0.0 [2019.0.0 Gold] at: C:/build/3rdparty/ippicv/ippicv_win/icv found Intel IPP Integration Wrappers sources: 2019.0.0 at: C:/build/3rdparty/ippicv/ippicv_win/iw Could not find OpenBLAS include. Turning OpenBLAS_FOUND off Could not find OpenBLAS lib. Turning OpenBLAS_FOUND off A library with BLAS API not found. Please specify library location. LAPACK requires BLAS A library with LAPACK API not found. Please specify library location. Could NOT find JNI (missing: JAVA_AWT_LIBRARY JAVA_JVM_LIBRARY JAVA_INCLUDE_PATH JAVA_INCLUDE_PATH2 JAVA_AWT_INCLUDE_PATH) VTK is not found. Please set -DVTK_DIR in CMake to VTK build directory, or to VTK install subdirectory with VTKConfig.cmake file OpenCV Python: during development append to PYTHONPATH: C:/build/python_loader CMake Error at cmake/OpenCVUtils.cmake:331 (target_include_directories): Cannot specify include directories for target "opencv_test_core_SSE4_1" which is not built by this project. Call Stack (most recent call first): cmake/OpenCVModule.cmake:675 (ocv_target_include_directories) cmake/OpenCVModule.cmake:1239 (ocv_target_include_modules) modules/core/CMakeLists.txt:97 (ocv_add_accuracy_tests)
CMake Error at cmake/OpenCVUtils.cmake:331 (target_include_directories): Cannot specify include directories for target "opencv_test_core_SSE4_2" which is not built by this project. Seems to be something checking about pthreads? Doesn't make sense in Win platforms? I don't know enough of CMake for Windows to sense what's wrong here.

Could you try this fix <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/15835>#15835</denchmark-link> (clean build directory first)? <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Seems to be something checking about pthreads? Doesn't make sense in Win platforms?
I didn't look in details, but MinGW can emulate pthreads API. Failed checks in CMake are NOT errors.

One thing to note, in that branch, invoking Generate (with or without CV_DISABLE_OPTIMIZATION) causes this error: <denchmark-code>Configuring done CMake Error: install(EXPORT "OpenCVModules" ...) includes target "opencv_hal" which requires target "ippiw" that is not in any export set. CMake Error in CMakeLists.txt: export called with target "opencv_hal" which requires target "ippiw" that is not in any export set. </denchmark-code>
So I believe <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/15835>#15835</denchmark-link> likely resolves the CV_DISABLE_OPTIMIZATION issue, but worth noting the above error happens on Generate in that branch. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/files/3801151/CMakeOutput.log>CMakeOutput.log</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/files/3801152/CMakeError.log>CMakeError.log</denchmark-link>
